inn1.comm: back of a length outside off, and he waits on it before defending towards point
back of a length, a fair distance outside off, and he leaves it alone
a bit fuller, but just as wide, and he presses forward before leaving the ball
back of a length, angling in towards off stump, and he defends back to the bowler, off the back foot
wide half-volley and he comes forward and drives square, between point and cover, with a slightly open face
big forward press, and there's a bit of bounce as it angles in from back of a length, and he takes the bottom hand off to defend and gets a thickish inside edge down towards square leg
angled in, back of a length, and he covers the line and defends off the back foot
onto the pads, and he tucks it away but square leg dives to his right and makes a good stop. Mithun Ali.
that's wide outside off, and there was some late movement away, but it had to pitch closer to the batsman to make him play
short and wide, but that moves away a touch and Rahane is beaten as he tries to cut
good ball! Pitched outside off, just back of a length, and Rahane was beaten by movement away off the seam as he tried to defend off the back foot
short and wide again, and he doesn't quite middle this cut and it rolls towards point at an amiable pace
that snaked back in from a good length. Drew Uthappa forward, but he let it go because it was sufficiently wide of off stump. Good carry too
angled onto the pads, and he works it down to mid-on
angled in towards off stump. Hangs back and gets a thickish inside edge into the leg side as he tries to defend down the ground
on a good length, angling in towards off stump, and he tucks it away towards midwicket
fuller still, and he presses forward, comes out of his crease, actually, and checks his drive to hit along the ground to cover
uppish, but he finds the gap behind point with that airy, open-faced punch against this shortish ball outside off
short, wide outside off, and he leaves it alone
angled in again, and he steps out of his crease and across the stumps to tuck it off his pads, behind square leg
lots of angle in, and a bit of bounce as well. He's making a conscious effort to come forward, and this one rose at him and hit him on the gloves
this one straightened and took off, and he was beaten by the movement and the bounce as he poked outside off after shuffling across his stumps. Keeper took that way above his head
fuller now, and he gets nicely forward to defend to mid-off
short and wide, and he throws his bat at it without moving his feet and doesn't get anywhere near connecting. It moved away off the seam as well
back of a length, angling in, and Uthappa shuffles across to defend down the pitch
length ball wide outside off and he takes a big step forward and across before opting to leave
homing in towards off stump now, and he defends watchfully from the crease
length ball outside off, lots of carry, Uthappa can let it go on bounce it go even though there was a big inward angle

got him! drew him into the drive with one that was pitched right up, almost a half-volley, and he pressed forward and tried to drive without quite getting to the pitch. It bounced a bit, took his outside edge, and carried at chest height to slip
rose from back of a length, with a sharp inward angle, and Pujara has to lean backwards and throw his arms up above his head to leave that
short and it was there to cut, but once again he's beaten. He hasn't played this shot well at all today

and India have lost both their openers. Rahane was trying to work this shortish ball into the leg side with the angle, but it bounced much higher than he expected and got up to chest height. Opened him up, took his outside edge, and slip took the catch above his head
back of a length outside off and he leaves it alone
this one came in and bounced, and hit him on the flap of his front pad as he came forward to defend. Ran towards point and they sneak a quick leg-bye
back of a length ball, lots of bounce again, but it was wide outside off and he left it comfortably
angled in towards off. He comes forward, waits, and angles his bat face adroitly to dab it into the leg side, to the right of midwicket
back of a length, angling in towards off, and he defends into the covers off the back foot
wider outside off this time, and he lets it go
big angle in, and he gets his front leg out of the way to make room for the bat to come down straight and defends towards mid-on
waits on this ball outside off, dabs it with soft hands into the off side but backward point is quick to the ball to snuff out any chance of a single
slightly shorter, shapes for the punch, but he's cramped for room and doesn't get too much power into it, hits it straight to cover
a bit more width, and he gets off his toes and punches this just wide of point, who dives to his right and gets a hand on it
digs this in, and Pujara crouches under the ball to let it go
length ball outside off, steep bounce again as Pujara comes forward and lets it go

fuller, and he comes forward but waits until the last moment, lets it hit his bat and drop down softly into the leg side. Looks like he's making a conscious effort to play with soft hands and rotate the strike
angled in, straightens from an off stump line, and he's on the walk a little but defends safely enough, into the off side
lots of inward angle, and maybe some movement too, and it passes fairly close to off stump after Rayudu leaves it alone
fullish ball, and it may have moved away a touch. Looks to drive through cover without really getting to the pitch of it, and slices it down towards third man

what a bizarre shot! That was a short ball, angling in, and I suppose he was trying to dab it down towards third man, I think. Big angle, and extra bounce, though, and he ends up gloving it straight into Mushfiqur's gloves
digs it in again, outside off, and Tiwary arches backwards and drops his gloves to let it go

pokes at this shortish ball, and it leaves him outside off and beats his outside edge. With that, the players run off the field and the groundstaff hurry in with the covers. The rain has started all of a sudden, and it looks pretty heavy
short and wide, and it's too far from Tiwary to really middle that cut. Hits it off the bottom part of the bat towards point.
short again, and a lot of bounce. He goes for the uppercut, a dangerous shot considering there's a third man on the ropes, but it drops down well short of the fielder.
shortish, outside off, and he lets this one go
length ball, angling in, and he gets a good stride in and defends towards point
full, comes in sharply, and it beats his defensive prod and hits him high on the front pad. Angling down, and going over too, I suppose. Drops down into the leg side for a leg-bye

and he's gone! He didn't have to play at that. It was short, outside off, leaving him slightly, and he pushed at it with hard hands and edged it thickly to second slip. It might have gone off the face, actually, considering how open it was
back of a length, angling across towards off stump. He jumps across and knocks this softly down into the leg side
rises up towards his hips, and he goes deep in his crease and tucks it down to deep backward square leg
shortish ball outside off, Pujara lets it go
back of a length, angling across, and he goes back and across to defend towards mid-off

big appeal, but I think that was a thick inside edge onto his pad as he went back to defend. They go for the quick single as the ball trickles into the off side, and Pujara makes his crease safely with the dive as cover slides in with the underarm throw but demolishes the stumps with his body in the process
shortish ball, tennis-ball bounce, and he sways out of the way
back of a length, just outside off, defended solidly into the covers
slants this onto the pads, and he gets some pad on it as he tries to clip it behind square leg
fullish ball, but he goes deep in his crease anyway and defends solidly but idiosyncratically down the pitch
big forward press to this ball outside off, waits for it to come to him, and dabs it with an open face towards third man
short, wide, and he cuts this crisply past backward point. Lovely timing
full, wrong line, and he flicks it off his toes between midwicket and mid-on
that's wide outside off, and it leaves him a touch. Swishes at it and misses after giving himself room and trying to hit over cover
good-looking shot this time. Big back and across step before he presses forward and drives this on the up to the right of cover
goes back to this back of a length ball which straightens a touch, and he gets a thickish outside edge down to third man
shortish ball, not too much room to work with, but he gets off his toes and manages to manoeuvre this down to third man
seams in, but it's short enough for Pujara to leave, even though it wasn't too far from off stump
angled in towards the stumps. Plays it late, with soft hands, with the angle towards midwicket
shot! rose to his toes and square-cut that wide one powerfully behind point and to the right of third man
short, rising ball outside off, and Pujara lets it go
angled in towards off, back of a length, Pujara defends off the back foot
length ball, angling in on the corridor, Pujara leaves again
on the pads again, and he tucks it neatly, wide of mid-on
slides this well down the leg side. Doesn't get up too much, and Mushfiqur is down on his knees to collect.

what are you doing, Suresh! Pujara tucks this to the left of midwicket, and Raina had hared out of the crease before he was sent back from close to the middle of the pitch. Turned and sprinted desperately back, but the throw didn't hit the stumps
back of a length, outside off, pushed in front of point
angled in, bit of bounce, and it's near his rib-cage when he tries to work it into the leg side. Goes down to fine leg off his glove or the shoulder of his bat
once again, it's on his pads, as he shuffles across, and he works it wide of mid-on for more runs
slanted across, and it's too wide. He doesn't go for the full-blooded cut, but guides this behind point with an open face, and third man makes a diving stop on the boundary. It was Taskin.
that's short and wide and he jumps in the air to play his favourite square cut, behind point and to the right of third man
digs this one in very short, and Pujara semi-ducks (he doesn't really have to) and lets it sail way over his head and drop down into the keeper's gloves
edged, but falls well short of second slip. He came forward to this one, and it straightened and took his outside edge, but he was playing very close to his body and not pushing at it at all
gets this one all wrong, slides way down the leg side on a fullish length
short and wide, and he cuts hard but Shakib dives to his left and gets his hands to it to keep it down to one
down the pitch and moves away from leg stump as well, to make room to slap that on the up into the covers
goes deep in his crease, and waits a long time before dabbing it down behind square, but Shakib is quickly on to the ball from point to prevent the single
beaten! that one's angled across, and it bounces extra and Raina is opened up and plays down the wrong line but doesn't poke his bat away from the body
leg-stumpish again, rises towards his hip, and he nudges it into the leg side but sends Pujara back
jumps across the crease and keeps this rising delivery down with a nice straight bat
onto the pads again, but this time he plays it straight to mid-on
down the leg side this time, and Raina can't get bat to it as he tries to glance it
gets the outside edge as Raina's bat comes down from around gully as he tries to defend this off stump ball. Goes safely, all along the ground, to third man
doesn't quite come on to the bat as he would have liked, and he's early into this cut and hits it towards cover
angled across, bit of bounce, and he gets behind this one to defend into the off side
that's very short. Raina was backing away to play the uppercut or slash, maybe, but he had no option but to leave as it bounced way over his head. Given wide
short, and he shuffles across and plays a controlled pull down to deep square leg
back of a length, rises up, and Pujara gets off his toes to bunt it down into the off side
jumps up again, but it's a touch wider, and he dabs it down behind point
once again, he drifts onto the pads, and he clips it down to deep square leg
short, and it's angling in towards his head. Has to bend backwards, literally, to let it go
full, angling away after pitching on off, and Raina lets it go
onto the pads again, and he tucks it down to deep square leg
that moves away, having already pitched in line with the tramline outside off, and Pujara couldn't have played it even if he had wanted to
closer to off stump now, and away movement again. Pujara leaves once more
this straightens from a fullish length outside off, and Pujara leaves again
full, outside off, and he comes nicely forward to defend into the covers
shorter this time, just wide of the corridor, and he leaves it alone
length ball outside off, Raina defends back to the bowler
taken! that was a poor ball, turning down the leg side, and Mushfiq takes a terrific catch down the leg side as Raina attempts to sweep and gloves it behind
fullish ball outside off, and he comes forward to defend into the off side
similar delivery, and he comes forward, waits a touch longer to dab it down towards point
onto the pads this time, and he goes back and across to work it behind square leg
tossed up nicely, and it turns away sharply from off stump, but Saha smothers it with a downward-facing bat to defend towards slip
that's a length ball outside off, lots of carry, and Pujara lets it go
short, and there's just enough width for Pujara to cut hard behind point. Bounces over the infield off the square and runs away quickly for four
that's full, on off stump, and he defends with a slightly closed face to play it with the angle towards midwicket

bit of bounce, is there, and Saha gets that high on the bat, or on the gloves, as he comes forward to defend. Doesn't push out to it, so it rolls down in front of cover. Mahmudullah races in and underarms a throw that misses the stumps at the batting end as Pujara dives in, and they run an overthrow
length ball outside off, and he gets a big stride in to defend towards cover
walks out of his crease to this one, and leans on it to defend into the covers
tossed up on off stump, and he comes forward to defend
more flight, and he plays late to defend towards cover
onto the pads now, and he works it away to the right of midwicket
lots of turn, and Saha is beaten as he pokes outside off at this really loopy delivery from Shakib
this one is quicker, and it slides towards the stumps, and he comes forward to defend back to the bowler
outside off this time, and he comes forward and plays late to dab towards backward point
a bit of outswing, but it starts from way outside off. Called wide
bit of outswing again,and Pujara's looking for the cut initially but decides not to play it at the last moment
this one's short enough to cut and he threads it nicely through that gap behind point and in front of third man
that's the full, wide outswinger, and he gets fully forward, realises he hasn't gotten to the pitch, and lets it go
short, and Pujara gets into line to pull that uppishly but safely behind square
ooh. Bit of outswing again, and he comes down the track and tries to flick across the line but gets a leading edge that Shakib fields at point, diving to his left
big appeal, but that was definitely missing off after Saha plays across the line again and is beaten by the outswing. Hit him on the back pad, but he had shuffled right across
turn and bounce, and it spins past Pujara's edge as he comes forward to defend. Didn't push out at it though
bigger stride forward this time, to defend into the off side
short, and he's slapped that to sweeper cover
bit of bounce, and he hits this uppishly over the head of the backtracking Gazi, who was coming in from point, after trying to slash off the front foot
back of a length, and he's right back in the crease to defend

Shakib is disgusted after that was given not out. It went with the arm, and it hit Pujara's front pad as he came forward to defend, but it might have struck him outside the line of off stump. Whoa. No. That was well in line. Lucky Pujara.
full, on off stump, and he's opened up by the outswing but defends safely into the off side
short, and he's pulled that nicely in front of square from outside off. Lands just inside the ropes.
comes down the track, and he slides this down the leg side. Gets his bat down quickly and tickles it to the fine leg boundary
on the pads, and he flicks it to midwicket
length ball outside off, he comes forward and lets it go
short, wide, and he's punched it hard but straight to point
waits on this one, and dabs it gently down to the left of cover
short, turns away, and he gets room to try and punch that in front of point, but the fielder dives to his right and makes a good stop
this is even shorter, and he rocks back and slaps it hard and uppishly to the left of cover. Sweeper comes around to stop that
overcompensates, and bowls it too full, and too wide down the leg side
bowled him! Wriddhiman was looking to cut this, but it didn't turn as he expected, and it was too full anyway, and it cramped him for room and crashed into middle stump

did that carry? He poked at this after coming forward, and it turned and got an outside edge on it. Nasir Hossain dived forward and took it very low. They're checking with the third umpire, and I think he got his fingers under it, but it's not too easy to tell for sure... aaaaaand they've given Binny the benefit of doubt
that's full, on the stump, and he drives it towards mid-on
back of a length, well outside off, and Pujara leaves it alone
fuller now, and angled in towards off. Pujara waits on it and defends into the leg side
short, and he's opened his face and sliced it down towards third man
shortish ball outside off, and he looks to set off for a single after dabbing it down towards point, but it went too quickly to him and Pujara sends Binny back
beaten outside off as he wafts at a length ball. Was trying to run that down to third man, maybe. Same shot got him out in the previous game
that was wide, and he had reason to throw his bat at that, but he didn't throw his bat out at the right moment or along the right direction, and the ball goes over his bat and beats him
given this time! This time, it turned a lot from middle stump and beat his outside edge as he poked forward to defend. Hit him on the back thigh, in front of middle-and-off
and he comes forward confidently to sweep this to deep backward square leg
stretches forward to this tossed-up ball outside off and defends carefully towards point
down the pitch now, and he flick-drives towards mid-on
comes forward and drives this through extra cover with a nice follow-through. Long off runs to his left to stop that
shorter this time, and it was the arm ball, but Binny managed to rock back and cut that inches in front of off stump and send it screaming away behind point
appeals after this straightens and hits him on the pad as he tries to defend off the back foot, but it was well above the knee-roll
he's gone! that was a length ball, angled across, and he threw his hands at it without moving his feet, and gets a thick edge through to the keeper
that's shortish and wide-ish, and he lets it go
shorter and wider than the previous one, and Mohit is beaten as he tries to slash at it
bit of movement away, and he tries to cut that while his feet move away from the line, and he gets nowhere near it
this is fuller, outside off, and he lets it go after pressing forward
tries to sweep from outside off and doesn't connect. Ball spins away quite a bit
tries to fire it in a little quicker and ends up slanting down the leg side
beautifully bowled. Hangs this in the air outside off, and he pokes forward and is beaten bu the turn
down the pitch, gets inside the line, and chips this over cover and well wide of the mid-off fielder
fuller this time, and he drives it well but straight to cover
this time he waits a touch longer to place that drive wide of cover, to his left. Sweeper cover does the fielding
skidder on off stump, and he goes back and defends watchfully into the off side
short and wide, but he isn't really in position to cut, with his front leg pulling away towards the leg side, and he's beaten
that's a lot of bounce but not very well directed. Way outside off and Mushfiq has to leap in the air and stretch his arms over his head to collect that
full, wide, and he drives this towards cover
slower ball, and he tries to play the cover drive but inside-edges it into the leg side
back of a length, straightens outside off, and beats the outside edge as Mohit tries to punch towards mid-off
away movement again, and Mohit is beaten once more as he tries to poke this towards cover
hits him on the front pad as he defends down the wrong line, but it was sliding well down leg
down the pitch and he plays a wristy on-drive to long-on
tossed up full on off, and he comes forward and drives to long-off
that's nicely tossed up outside off, and he's beaten as he tries to drive through cover
full, on the pads, and he works it off his toes towards backward square leg
skids towards the stumps, and he presses forward and defends stoutly
flat, back of a length, outside off, and he shuffles across and defends into the off side
slides down the leg side, and Binny gets a little tickle on it and it runs away past short fine leg for four
full, on the stumps, and he comes forward to defend
down the leg side again, and it turns past Binny's hip as he tries to glance
full, works it into the midwicket area
down the pitch, and he flicks this to the right of midwicket
quickish ball on off stump, and he goes back and tucks it down towards midwicket
that's a long hop that turns down the leg side, and he swivels to pull that away powerfully behind deep square leg
fuller now, and he comes forward and it turns and hits him on the front thigh
couple of steps down the pitch and defended solidly back to the bowler
short, and turning in. He made good room for the cut but missed the line
deep in his crease now and punches it down to long-on
shortish ball, turning in with some bounce. Mohit tries to play the late dab but can't quite get bat on it
Sohag Gazi to Binny, no run, back of a length outside off, punched back to the bowler
goes back this time and tucks this off his legs behind square
full, outside off, and he comes forward to defend into the off side
that's an easy decision. spins back sharply from outside off, and it's hit his pad right in front of the stumps as he shuffled across to defend

he may not score as many here. Came forward and tried to defend but it went straight on and beat his outside edge. He was stretched fully forward and the keeper took the bails off, and it looks like his toe is on the line... There's a part of his foot behind the line but that part is in the air. Looks out, I think... No! It's given not out!
shortish ball, and he goes back and works it off his pads to square leg
back of a length on off, and he defends into the off side off the back foot
there's that slider again, and it pings Binny on the front pad. Frantic appeal, and it isn't given. I guess he was struck outside the line.
